result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • James Michael Steiner was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,544.00 Fine must be paid on or before February 28, 2018 or a 31 day jail commitment may be imposed. Defendant is to begin paying $150 per month beginning April 1, 2017.

65 Days Jail are Imposed.  20 Days Jail are Stayed pending successful completion of the IDIP Program. The defendant will serve the remaining 45 days as follows:  The first 48 hours will commence immediately without huber/work release.  After serving the first 48 hours the defendant will be furloughed until March 15, 2017 at 10:00 AM which at that time the defendant will return to the Pierce Co. Jail to serve the remaining 43 days of sentence on huber/work release.  Release date: April 12, 2017 
A violation of the IDIP rules while on Electronic Home Monitoring may be a cause for a contempt of court proceeding, may also be a basis for arrest and may be cause for termination from the IDIP program.
24 month revocation of driver license. Credit for administrative suspension.

IID for a period of 1 year to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.
IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY
Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

9:12  Defendant James Michael Steiner in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def will plead to OWI 3rd today per Atty Harrelson. OSullivan files an amended information which the court reads to the defendant.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1 of the amended information.     Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def .  Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 1 of the amended information and dismisses Ct 2.   OSullivan addresses the sentence. Defendant has been in th IDIP program since April 14, 2016.    .144 TEST.      Court orders:
      $ 1744.00  Fine Defendant is to pay $150 per month beg 4-1-17
       24 Months Revocation of Driver License. Credit for adm suspension
    65   Days Jail are Imposed.     20 Days Jail are Stayed pending successful completion of the IDIP Program. The def will serve the remaining 45 days as follows: The first 48 hours will commence immediately without huber. After serving the first 48 hours the def will be furloughed until March 15, 2017 at 10:00 AM which at that time the def will return to PCJ to serve the remaining 43 days of sentence on huber/work release. Release date: April 12, 2017.
Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed
IID must be installed for a period of 1 year. $50.00 IID Surcharge is imposed. The IID requirement will commence when the defendant obtains any type of drivers license or when the defendant decides to drive w/o a valid driver license.
2 days credit is given for jail time served.    Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 
Release date is the 12th of April 2017
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.
from Atty Harrelson re: request the status conference set in November be continued as a plea sometime in January.
Cover Letter
Status conference on November 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:39 Defendant James Michael Steiner in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan states the Def is participating in the IDIP program. Harrelson agrees. Court will set for another status to allow negotitations to be completed.  Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from Judge Duvall to Atty OSullivan's letter date 7/26 re: ruling remains as pronounced.
from Atty OSullivan re: Judicial notice statute, Washington State OWI Statute and Defendant's certified driving record.
Status conference on September 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.

11:09 Defendant James Michael Steiner in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Collateral attack motion filed by Atty Harrelson.  Harrelson a federal military base offense is not admissible. Atty OSullivan disagrees. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Atty OSullivan responds. Court: Washington County conviction is out. Atty Harrelson: 2004 MN conviction is challenged and gives argument for choice of law issue. Court refers to Minnesota Rule 5.04(1)(3). Atty Osullivan gives argument. Court: finds what procedure should apply for a waiver of out of state conviction: standard to apply; waiver of right to counsel. Constititional standard for each state should be used. Minnesota standard was used in the 2004 conviciton. Procedure was not violated. It's valid under MN law.  The State has not proven the prima facia showing on the Washington conviction. Court: this is now a 3rd offense. 1st one out, 2nd 2 are in.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's of Law: Choice of Law -  Waiver of Counsel filed by Atty Harrelson
Motion hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
for Continuance filed by Atty OSullivan
Motion hearing on May 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.
of Jeremiah James Harrelson
of James Michael Steiner
Defendant's to Exclude Prior "Convictions" from Case-in-Chief and from sentencing filed by Atty Harrelson
Status conference on May 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.

1:32 Defendant James Michael Steiner in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan: set for another pre trial 60 days out for Atty Harrelson to explore 1st OWI, which may have been on a military base. Atty Harrelson agrees. Court sets a status conference for May.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.
State's
Pre-trial conference on March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

11:39   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing to all counts.  Not guilty plea received by the court  The bond will continue as ordered.  Pretrial Conference to be set with Judge Duvall on 3/22/16 at 1:30 p.m. Notices will be printed for the parties. 11:42

10:59 Defendant James Michael Steiner in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Thomas Koen is sworn and exam by Atty OSullivan. Officer Koen id's defendant. Xexam by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by Atty OSullivan. ReXexam by Atty Harrelson. Arguments given.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 03-15-2016 10:30 am.

4:00 Defendant James Michael Steiner in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court with Def.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.
